list_definition.definition: to pull (a ship, barge, car, trailer etc) by a rope, chain or cable

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The tugboat towed the ship out of the harbour
The car broke down and had to be towed to the garage.

list_definition.definition: (an) act of towing or process of being towed

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We asked one of the neighbours to give us a tow.

list_ex_of_english: In the ranges of the four controllable variables where the volume approaches capacity, average tow delays are large and change much faster than elsewhere.
